title.narrative: Power Sector Development Technical Assistance Project

description.narrative: The project Development Objectives are to: a) Create effective capacity within the Government (Ministry of Power, Energy and Mineral Resources) to put in place power sector policies, industry structures, and a gas supply strategy needed for balanced development of Bangladesh's power sector; b) Create capacity within the Energy Regulatory Commission to regulate the sector effectively; and c)Prepare and secure financing for, at least two well-structured power sector investment projects that are then efficiently implemented.

condition.narrative: The Borrower shall convene a meeting once a year to brief the DPs on progress of implementing power sector policy andintitutionalr eforms.
The Borrower will provide IDA a progress report every 6 months summarising actions taken to advance the 3-Yr. Road Map for PowerSe ctor Reforms, with periodic updating.

title.narrative: (a) Siddhirganj Power Co. formed to own 3 peaking plants & qualified firm contracted for operations & mgt (b) Qalified Mgt team contracted to improve operations & mgt of Chittagong & Sylhet Dist. Co.

baseline.value: Baseline Zero.Financing 2 peaking plants secured fm ADB. IDA considers 3rd plant fm PSIDP. No agreemnt w/ ADB & GOB on Mgt StrucofPlant. Prep. of Sid Plant and Ctg. pjkt underway.

target.value: Siddhiragnj and Ctg. Power Co (SZ) . operations improved through corprate governance framework and introduction of qualifiedmanagement teams.

comment.narrative: Siddhiragnj operations are improving through corporate governance framework and introduction of qualified management teams.
EGCB manages and operates 2 peaking units and contracted NTPC, India for O&M services. EGCB is working to hire another O&M for 335MW CCPP.

title.narrative: Crprte Gov.structures & policies in place for at least 2 pwr. entrprises to facilitate a. Trnsprnt. & efficient decision making b. Accountable mgt c. Credible monitoring & d. Imprved Mgt. & Oprtins.

baseline.value: Baseline 15%.The "Corporate" entities created under company law but fallen short of acceptable levels of corporate governance.Sidrgnj.power plnt to be built in 2yrs. & SZ Co. targted fr improvmnt.

target.value: Corporate Governance framework designed, adopted in 2 power companies resulting transpaernt decisions, accountable management,credible monitoring of performance; and management and operations improved by global experts.

comment.narrative: Improved capacity observed in power enterprises in investment preparation, corporate governance reporting, transparent decisionmaking, public procurement, company governance, and operating performance. Utility level MOUs on KPIs signed, and are beingmonitored by Power Division.

title.narrative: Priority regulations issued: Tariff setting; lease cost inv; economic dispatch; grid/distribution codes; BERC issues licenses & tariff rulings consistent with good industry practices.

baseline.value: Baseline 5%. Some draft document were prepared by ADB consultants a few years ago. Once BERC is properly staffed, it will need toreview status of regulations and update/issue as appropriate.

target.value: Priority regulations issued and BERC issues license and tariff rulings consistent with good industry practices.

actual.value: 95% todate. Will continue under RERED-II support.

comment.narrative: Priority regulations on licensing and tariff setting on power generation and gas transmission and distribution made. Tariffregulations on power transmission and distribution under public hearing. BERC is issuing periodic tariff orders on electricity(bulk and retail) and CNG to achieve gradual financial sustainability of the sectors. distribution. BERC is working on standardsof performance. The above are consistent with good industry practices.

title.narrative: Gas sector master plan will identify near, mid & long term gas infrastructure development priorities.

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Comprehensive plan does not exist

target.value: Near, mid and long term gas infrastructure development priorities identified. The Gas Sector Road Map (RM) is being implemented.

comment.narrative: Gas sector master plan prepared and identified near, mid and long term gas infrastructure development priorities. The master planhas been updated under the Financing and Implementation plan for gas sector development, supported by the project.

title.narrative: (i) Timely collation & analysis of sector reform data (ii) Monthly invoices between enterprises based on accurate meter readings.

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Decline in funding for Power Cell over last few years resulted in lapse in advancing the reform prog & monitoringits progress. State of inter-Enterprise metering needs to be assessed.

target.value: Sector reform and performance data collated and anlysed in timely manner and monthly invoices between entities prepared andfurnished based on accurate meter readings.

comment.narrative: Sector reform and performance data collated and anlyzed periodically and monthly invoices between entities prepared and furnishedbased on accurate meter readings.

ALL power and gas utilities provide regular/monthly updates on sector reforms, procurement, operations and investments. Allutilitywebsites publish updated information including those on procurement, operations and financial performance and governance.The BPDButilizes the system meter readings in inter-utility monthly bills on energy flows.

title.narrative: Power Policies adopted, particularly for underpinning: (i) Financial Recovery; (ii) Faster access for all; (iii) Private participation

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Financial recovery plan to be prepared before policy is formulated; rural accress proceeding well, however policiesto be updated to improve quality of supply. PPP framework be updated.

target.value: FRP, CPP, GMP Corporationsation/PPP and Gen. Fin. Strgy. prepared, adopted, being implemented.

comment.narrative: Financial Restructuring and recovery Plan(FRP), Captive Power Policy (CPP), Gas Master Plan and Strategy (GMP&S), GenerationFinancing Strategy (GFS), Transaction Advice to Generation Expansion (IPPs and EPC contracts) prepared, adopted, being implemented.

title.narrative: Gas Sector Master Plan & Strategy prepared, including to meet gas demand from power, industry & other sectors

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Gas Master Plan does exist & development decisions appear to be taken with a greater regard to political & emotiveaspects, lacking crediable analysis.

target.value: Gas Master Plan and Strategy prepared and adopted. GOB continues to implement Gas Master Plan and Strategy.

comment.narrative: PB has updated the Gas Master Plan and Strategy (GMP&S) in 2012 in its recent report on Implementation and Financing Plan for GasSector Development, supported by PSDTA . It provides updated and encouraging reserve estimate and strategy to meet gas demand bypower, industry and other users. GOB continues to implement the GMP&S. . i

title.narrative: Training plan for each beneficiary to be designed under component A and agreed with IDA

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Inadequate attention within existing enterprises to human resources develoment.

target.value: Trainings imparted improved human resources of unbundled entities and BERC. This contributed to improved sector peformance intermsof customer satisfaction by better electricity supply and service.

comment.narrative: Project funded training and study tours carried out on several areas of power, gas, energy and related regulations. These havebuilt institutional capacity of power and energy ministries, related utilities, planning ministries, etc. Training on twinning/JVresulted in a few MOUs. NTPC-BPDB Power company formed to finance , implement and operate a 1,300 MW coal-fired power plant inKhulna.

title.narrative: Detailed design of power sector restruc. & fin recvry plan; corporatisation guidelns for public enterp; updtd Power Sec Mastr Plan & fin & proc strategy; social safguard framwork- imprv acces

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. No formal FRP for the Power sector and guideline for corporatisn of supply entities; PSMP last updtd in 1995. A pvtpower policyexists but has not been applied uniformly.

target.value: Credible Financial recovery plan to restore sector's creditworthiness in reasonable time.

comment.narrative: A complete power sector FRP, Utility Balance Sheet adjustments, and update on adjustments made are available.

A credible Financial recovery plan to restore sector's creditworthiness is in place and under implementation. Both tariff and nontariff measures are under implementation including Utility Balance Sheet cleaning work, power tariff setting to gradually reachcost level and updating utility financial models to reflect updated figures.

title.narrative: Regulatory processes in place, particularly for: (i) Power tariff setting (ii) service quality monitoring (iii) least cost investment & operations planning & improved public preception of power.

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. No separation between policy making & regulation. Limited separation between operation & policy making/regulation

target.value: BERC issued regulations on licensing, tarrif setting and performnce standards. It issues license, sets/vets tariff, and resolvesconflicts.

comment.narrative: Regulatory processes are in place on licensing, power and gas tariff setting, service quality monitoring and investment &operations planning & improved public perception of power.

title.narrative: Monitoring, reporting & invoicing of power flows between enterprises based on accurate system metering.

baseline.value: Baseline Zero. Quality of present data uncertain & expected to improve with better metering, crediable separation of generation,transmission &dist entities, & autonomous regulation

target.value: Compliance on increased reliability on information on power flow and commercial invoices between unbundled power entities .

comment.narrative: Real time data from interface meters are providing accurate readings on inter-utility energy flow between unbundled entities andonquality of system operations. Monitoring and invoicing of power flows between BPDB and utilities are based on these data.
